instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2879: What is 820-2879? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U7000: What is U7000? U7000 refers to the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging IC on Macbooks from 2008-2012.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2879</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-b .     3.4v on battery connector but dropping 12v
threads.message:
I have another problem. I have board <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2879</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-b. I replaced <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> because has no green light. I managed to get green light but now i have 12v voltage drop on battery connector. Not really sure how to find problem. Any idea? I may ask to many times for help but am still learning

j6950 : 3v and dropping down
j6950 pin 6 and 4 : 3.416v

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2879</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-b .     3.4v on battery connector but dropping 12v

<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2879</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-b .     3.4v on battery connector but dropping 12v
threads.message: ok. i left board for two days because i had plenty boards to repair and today when i plugged in to charger and power up motherboard fan start spinning so i turned of and try power up again and was not start any more. i probly have short on some cappacitor but not sure how to find it. can you help?

<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2879</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-b .     3.4v on battery connector but dropping 12v
threads.message: Check sense resistors and traces, measure resistance between pin 17/18 and 27/28 on <CHIP>U7000</CHIP>.
